crypto.name: el camel
crypto.desc:
beginner crypto
This El-Camel guy's looking a bit weird...

crypto.name: tricks
crypto.desc:
The only practical use case of cryptography.

Note: An old version of this challenge had the flag K17{90oOfy_LLL_P41Ll13R_PR08L3M}. This is no longer the flag.

crypto.name: worsehelp
crypto.desc:
my betterhelp therapist turned out to be a sham

:(. my new one told me to use rsa. huh?

misc.name: ladies first
misc.desc:
Chivalry is dead.

To build locally, run sudo docker build -t ladies . sudo docker run -p 1337:5000 --privileged -d ladies then to connect, run nc localhost 1337

misc.name: phished
misc.desc:
easy +forensics
We fired Billy last week after he failed a phishing test for the 6th time. We wiped his machine, but now we really need one of the files that was on it. Maybe he uploaded it somewhere? Do you think you can get it back from this packet capture?

misc.name: smoothie
misc.desc:
beginner misc
I put the flag in a blender. Oops.

osint.name: dinner
osint.desc:
beginner osint
foood!!!! fooooood!!!!! what is the name of this venue?!?!!?!? TELL ME

(no need to wrap your answer in the K17 flag format, just enter the name)

osint.name: radioactive
osint.desc:
beginner osint
Where is this tower located?

Note: Please answer with coordinates rounded to 3 decimal places and wrap your answer with K17{}. For example, if you think that the tower is the Eiffel Tower, please submit K17{48.858,2.296}.

pwn.name: ezwins
pwn.desc:
beginner pwn
How old can it be to win?

pwn.name: holes
pwn.desc:
The worms have begun digging again. docker image is ubuntu:24.04

Note: Use the remote! The provided binary is only part of the challenge.

pwn.name: singular hole
pwn.desc: surely one singular hole is easier to handle than many holes

pwn.name: u get me write
pwn.desc: Surely one gets call wont get me fired right?

rev.name: bait and switch
rev.desc: This store promised me a free gift if I downloaded their app, but it's not working >:(

rev.name: jumping
rev.desc:
beginner rev
I made this game in high school and I can't seem to clear it! Can you help? Surely you wouldn't cheat!

rev.name: moopsy
rev.desc:
mipsy is an emulator for a custom variant of the MIPS ISA. It's used at UNSW for teaching low-level computer system fundamentals. I thought I'd show it some love by writing a small flag checker for it :D. If and only if the string inputted is correct, 1 will be printed ($a0).

Note: to run, use https://github.com/insou22/mipsy (https://cgi.cse.unsw.edu.au/~cs1521/mipsy/ also works)

rev.name: qna
rev.desc:
What does dna even stand for??

Note: The flag format for this challenge is CTF{.*}

web.name: autofill
web.desc: My colleague's web browser autofills his password whenever he loads a page. Can you find his password?

web.name: betabuf
web.desc:
We regret telling the intern about Protocol Buffers. Hopefully they'll clean things up before we leave closed beta.

Clarification: The --trusted-proxy args are not intended to be a part of the challenge. They are there because the remote sits behind a proxy. You can ignore them.

web.name: janus
web.desc: Someone hacked my space image viewer, but it's 100% secure now! Note: Attacking nasa's API is out of scope for this challenge and you may brute force at most 100 requests at one request per second.

web.name: pwnable document format
web.desc: We patched the XSS by modifying the library, surely it's secure now?
